intro: Saussurea micradenia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved saussurea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of China, Kazakhstan, and Mongolia. The plant is characterized by its tall, branched stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Saussurea micradenia is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, dry conditions.
